title: Does Veigar Stun You, Or Do You Stun Yourself?
body:
Does Veigar's W hit you, or do you decide suicide is the answer?

Did Veigar's Q hit you, or do you just want to save a minion?

Did Veigar's ult hit you, or did you walk up to him by accident thinking he was a caster minion?

replies.body: Or do I stun them, drop my combo and kill them all because I knew where they were going and was able to capitalize?

I know that when I play Veigar and stun someone I think, "why didn't you turn around?" or "why didn't you move?", "why not just stop moving" or "was he afk?"

You could make the argument of predicting their movement if they didn't see where the stun was coming. There no reason for someone to walk into it the way it is unless you have a teammate limit their options.

But that's where pressure comes in. Sometimes people panic. Sometimes they can't think straight.

I don't think of it as "why did you do this stupid thing?" (always, anyway). Sometimes it's "they are afraid of me, and they can either walk toward me and take a guaranteed Q and R, or they could keep running and hope to not get trapped in the cage. Sometimes, when they aren't stunned but are still within I can use W not to hit them necessarily, but I can limit their movements further.

NOT being stunned is not always SO bad. Obviously a stun is better, but trapping them within limits their movements and they are going to have trouble dodging all of your skills.

I'm not saying he DOESN'T need any changes. I'm not saying he doesn't need buffs or kill changes. But I am saying it's not impossible to play with what he has now. I've dominated games through hard work, and I've lost some when I didn't play that well.

Oh it's definitely not impossible to play him now I agree. I just feel he's too reliant on other people making mistakes. It's to the point when I do well with Veigar I can't tell if I did well or they just played poorly. That's the main reason I want him changed. I missed the old Veigar where you made the plays not where you just put others in a position to mess up.

Feeling like you never played well, that your opponent simply played worse, is never a good feeling.

I was low health running from a Kha'zix, and I hid in the bush behind the Dragon pit. He knew I was there, and I knew it, so I cast E. Completely missed him, because I didn't anticipate where he was going correctly. The wall is up (up, not setting up, up) for about 0.75 seconds when he walks into it, stunning himself. 

I drop W and Q and kill him, but it was a hollow victory. I did not win by my skill, I won by his stupidity. 

Unfortunately every game since Veigar's rework has felt much the same way.
You won that because you outsmarted him, which is still it's own victory.  This is still a strategy game, so outsmarting somebody is definitely a victory.

If I can only outsmart someone who's not capable of reacting to a stun with a 1.5 second warning (or longer, not sure on how long the wall was up), then that statement is more of an insult to me than anything...

>But that's where pressure comes in. Sometimes people panic. Sometimes they can't think straight.

Sometimes these people are bad at this game, sometimes this is the line thats drawn between the good players and the bad players. Sometimes isn't enough.

Veigars winrate is higher the lower the rank you are.  It's not surprisng. Simply put, depending on an enemy panicking isn't a good way to design a champion. Thats saying that veigars success depends on how bad the enemy you're facing is. 

A couple of years ago there were a couple of champs that relied on the enemy making a mistake and panicking but riot removed those abilities because they are poor design.

That's not the point I was trying to make. Listen, I'm not diamond or anything, but I'm a pretty damn good Veigar. So I guess what I mean is, you have to MAKE them panic? Or force them to mess up? Throw them off, you know? Be threatening!

Again, I'm not saying changes need to be made, but Veigar is playable and can even be strong as he is now. It just takes a lot of work and practice.

Veigar was balanced around his instant E stun. There's a reason his W takes 1.25 seconds to fall, nearly twice as long as Cho'Gath's Rupture, despite Rupture covering a larger area, applying cc, and both skills having 100% AP Scaling. Yet Riot hasn't changed W at all.

I know that people are bummed out about the veigar nerfs, but lets not just pretend that his whole kit revolved around landing one ability. That's absurd and highly inaccurate. Do you people honestly believe that the only way for veigar to land his ult or his q would be to stun his enemy first? Even his w can be placed strategically to give less mobile opponents a very small chance of reacting in time. It would be like saying that lux can only use her ult or e on enemies that she has hit with a binding. Is it much harder to aim and time her abilities without the snare first? yes. Is it impossible to do so? of course not. The same logic applies to veigar's w and q, and on top of that his ult is impossible to miss. Let's not over-exaggerate how weak veigar's kit is with a delayed stun.
